paper_abstract: In this paper, by considering a (3n+1) -dimensional random vector (X-0, X-T, Y-T, Z(T))(T) having a multivariate elliptical distribution, we derive the exact joint distribution of (X-0, a(T)X((n)), b(T)Y([n]), c(T)Z([n]))(T), where a, b, c(n), X-(n)=(X-(1), ..., X-(n))(T), X-(1)<<bold></bold><X-(n), is the vector of order statistics arising from X, and Y-[n]=(Y-[1], ..., Y-[n])(T) and Z([n])=(Z([1]), ..., Z([n]))(T) denote the vectors of concomitants corresponding to X-(n) ((Y-[r], Z([r]))(T), for r=1, ..., n, is the vector of bivariate concomitants corresponding to X-(r)). We then present an alternate approach for the derivation of the exact joint distribution of (X-0, X-(r), Y-[r], Z([r]))(T), for r=1, ..., n. We show that these joint distributions can be expressed as mixtures of four-variate unified skew-elliptical distributions and these mixture forms facilitate the prediction of X-(r), say, based on the concomitants Y-[r] and Z([r]). Finally, we illustrate the usefulness of our results by a real data.
paper_title: Prediction based on linear combinations of order statistics and bivariate concomitants in the case of multivariate elliptical distributions
